answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found a few resources that me helpful in answering your question.
This a description of the city budget process from Ontario which includes fund management processes as well. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3640/About_the_City_Budget_Process
The office of the New York State Comptroller has a couple of manuals that may also offer some assistance.
This is their official guide to Investing and Protecting Public Funds.
http://www.osc.state.ny.us/localgov/pubs/lgmg/investingpublicfunds.pdf
This is their local government Account and Reporting Manual.  Chapter 4 discusses fund schedules.
http://www.osc.state.ny.us/localgov/pubs/arm.pdf
I also included their Fiscal Responsibilities Guide which discusses funds on page 19.
http://www.osc.state.ny.us/localgov/pubs/townoff/ito.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Mark Zeihen
text:
Hi all,
I have a question regarding cash management and cash flow going into a City and/or County Treasurers from various City/County Departments.  Currently, we receive money from various County Departments, and hold that money in short-mid term investment accounts so that we may gain revenue, while safeguarding the principal.  The only problem is that the way County departments report to us is not at all uniform or consistent, so it makes it tough to know when departments want us to invest, and when they want their money back.  Has anyone experienced problems with lack of uniformity, and if so, how did you work to resolve the issue?  Did you create a database with which county departments reported to you with their daily expenses, and which funds they want you to investment?
I apologize if my question lacks clarity.  If you need further clarification, please let me know.
Thank you for your time!
title: City/County Treasurer - Fund Management
